Caveats

Laplace transform has a lot of counter intuitive expressions.

  1. Laplace transform of product of two functions is NOT the product of the Laplace transforms . However, if one of the functions is a constant, say , we can prove that the Laplace transform of is .

  2. The product of two Laplace transforms is the Laplace transform of a convolution

  3. Small s corresponds to large x, due to the nature of the exponential suppression in Laplace transform. For example, for small argument x, the function becomes almost 1, meanwhile, the Laplace transform of the function becomes under large s. We can see that the two limits are consistant since the Laplace transform of 1 is .

  4. In so many circumstance the Laplace transform doesn’t exist simple because the integral doesn’t converge. Please beware of this and use the transform only when it exists.
